Download All Available Data for a Given Station

Source: R/download_all_data_for_station.R
download_all_data_for_station.Rd

Downloads all available air quality measurements for a specified station by iterating over manageable date ranges. The function automatically retrieves station metadata from the list_stations() function and consolidates the chunked downloads into a single tibble.

Usage

download_all_data_for_station(
  station_id,
  parameters,
  frequency = c("hourly", "daily"),
  show_progress = TRUE,
  chunk_size = "1 year",
  parallel = FALSE,
  workers = NULL
)

Arguments

station_id

A character string representing the station's unique identifier.

parameters

A character vector of pollutant parameters (e.g., c("PM10", "CO", "NO2")).

frequency

Either "hourly" or "daily". Default is "hourly".

show_progress

Logical. If TRUE, displays informative messages during download. Default is TRUE.

chunk_size

A character string specifying the size of each download window passed to seq.POSIXt() (e.g., "1 month", "1 year"). Defaults to "1 year".

parallel

Logical. If TRUE, downloads will be performed in parallel using the future and furrr packages. You must set up a future plan before using this option (e.g., future::plan(future::multisession)). Default is FALSE.

workers

Integer. Number of parallel workers to use when parallel = TRUE. If NULL (default), uses the number of workers specified in the active future plan.

Value

A tibble containing the available time series air quality data for the given station. The tibble includes columns such as time, station_id, station_name, parameter, value, and other metadata columns retrieved from station information. All column names are in snake_case format.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # interactive()
# Download all available data for a station
all_data <- download_all_data_for_station(
  station_id = "468478b7-ace5-4bd3-b89a-a9c1c2e53080",
  parameters = c("PM10", "NO2"),
  frequency = "hourly",
  chunk_size = "3 months"
)
}
